Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Skills:
MS or Ph.D. or equivalent experience in a quantitative field
Strong background in the foundations of machine learning
Well read in the relevant literature around applications of machine learning or deep learning
Impressive projects in machine learning or deep learning or high performance computing
Passion for challenging the status quo and translating novel ideas into scalable systems
FullDescriptions:
Astound AI is a rapidly growing startup funded by top-tier venture capitalists. We are disrupting the way customer support is delivered. Are you interested in joining a startup where you can play a crucial role in designing and building new generation AI products vs. being a cog in the wheel in big groups at big companies? Do you have what it takes to solve challenging AI problems and build cutting edge AI products? Would you like to be a part of an elite team of AI pioneers in Silicon Valley building one of the most advanced AI systems for automating enterprise business processes?
We have an opportunity for a Machine Learning Scientist to play a key role in developing a high-profile AI platform in use by many of the world's most-respected organizations. If your expertise is in machine learning or deep learning for natural language processing and you are passionate about solving hard problems, join us for the adventure of a lifetime.
Required Skills:
MS or Ph.D. or equivalent experience in a quantitative field
Strong background in the foundations of machine learning
Well read in the relevant literature around applications of machine learning or deep learning
Impressive projects in machine learning or deep learning or high performance computing
Passion for challenging the status quo and translating novel ideas into scalable systems
Why you should apply:
AI for automating enterprise business processes is a huge opportunity. You'll have an opportunity to be a pioneer in a field that will define how machines and humans interact for the next decade or more.
Unique opportunity to join a venture-funded AI startup founded by seasoned serial entrepreneurs which is still in early stages.
You will be tackling some of the most exciting problems at the cutting edge of AI and Machine Learning.
You will be surrounded by passionate entrepreneurs who have lots of experience in solving real world AI problems! We're a small, tight-knit team doing big things.
We value innate intelligence, the curiosity to learn more, and the ability to solve hard problems. We reward innovation, creativity, initiative and teamwork.
We process immigration for qualified candidates. We are located in Menlo Park, California. Join us to define the new boundaries of AI and have plenty of fun along the way.

Title: US - Solution Architect
FullDescriptions:
Cognite is a young, innovative, fast-growing software company building the world's best industrial data platform. The Cognite Data Fusion ingests, processes and contextualizes huge amounts of industrial data to make it available for analysis, machine learning and day-to-day decision making. Cognite Group HQ is in Oslo, Norway and our North America HQ is in Austin, Texas with satellite office in Houston.

Our Solution Architect team makes things happen. As a Solution Architect, you will work directly with key customers, field sales, delivery, and product development teams. The customer sees you as the technical expert. Together with the team, you will define solutions and support each integration through to a successful finish.
A successful candidate must be highly organized, thorough, and communicate well with all stakeholders. You will be required to collaborate and lead, as well as work independently. Your work will have real impact on the success of Cognite and our customers. It is a challenging role, but you’ll be part of a great team that helps you excel and succeed!
We strive to build a diverse team that can leverage different strengths and backgrounds to build innovative products and nurture a great culture. We hire at different levels depending on your experience.

Tasks and responsibilities
You will be encouraged to use your own strengths and interests to take on a variety of responsibilities. These may include:
Provide technical expertise and support for customers and the Cognite Customer Success team. Provide guidance and find solutions that enable customers’ business use-cases
Establish good relationships with key IT Data Managers and Business Data Managers, to drive long-term adoption of Cognite’s products and services
Independently work with and manage integration and data modeling using Cognite data connectors, SQL, Python/Java and Rest APIs
Train partners in your area of specialization, including the creation of training materials, modeling guidelines, and best-practices
Collaborate with our R&D and Product Management teams to turn customer needs into a prioritized pipeline of product offerings
Develop and maintain technical and business expertise for Cognite’s products
Support pre-sales with technical expertise and seamless transfer to delivery phase

About you
You are creative and technical, able to think on your feet and roll up your sleeves. You:
Have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, related field, or equivalent experience
Have experience with data standards and technologies, such as:
Loading and transforming data (e.g. using ETL tools)
Using SQL
Programming experience (e.g., Java or Python)
Have experience from technical roles such as software engineer, data scientist, data engineer or similar.
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Are structured, self-motivated, and able to handle multiple assignments and projects at the same time
Are a strong team player, but prepared to drive projects and work independently
Are motivated to travel (amount of travel will vary, but at least 25% should be expected)
Have architectural skills dealing with data modeling and infrastructure solutions, such as classical data warehousing and big data architectures
Have experience with enterprise integration, customer relationships or IT integration design

Benefits
We are an exciting fusion of the technological and the industrial, fast growth and sustainable innovation.
Competitive salary and benefits (including 401K plans, health insurance, and more)
Opportunity to work with great people on projects that create real impact
Opportunity to be part of- and participate in global projects
Minimal bureaucracy and overhead, with focus on agility and speed
Regular internal or external tech-talks
All the tools you need to be productive
Open and friendly company culture
Emphasis on individual health, including access to private medical clinic
Flat structure with direct access to decision-makers
High level of autonomy and ability to influence decisions
New, attractive offices

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science or mathematics, or alternate degree showcasing machine learning skills
Experience collaborating on software projects using version control such as Git, GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.
Requirement:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science or mathematics, or alternate degree showcasing machine learning skills
Experience collaborating on software projects using version control such as Git, GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.
FullDescriptions:
Come help us craft the future

Senseye aims to revolutionize the way humans communicate with technology. We are developing a unique, sensory interface technology to create a direct link from a computer to a human’s mind via the complex dynamic properties of the human eye.

We're looking for a machine learning engineer that loves solving meaningful problems to join our team in downtown Austin. We are a diverse group of people with a broad range of backgrounds, experience, and perspectives who have a lot of work to do and we're excited to have your help to achieve our visionary goals.
About you

You have knowledge and experience with a wide variety of machine learning and statistical models, applying these tools to computer vision and tabular problems. You are comfortable making additions to existing production code based on modeling needs and updates. You understand the unique challenges of modeling compared to software development and have balanced these needs in past projects. You have experience defining modeling problems, preparing data through analysis, wrangling, cleaning, training, and testing statistical and machine learning models. You understand the difference between a test score in model building and actual product performance and know how to design processes to quantify this. You use your knowledge of machine learning algorithms to computer vision products as well as making predictions on statistical datasets. You work comfortably with APIs and out-of-memory data. You are curious, dedicated to learning and improvement, and have no problem being honest about where a modeling project is at and what its limitations might be.


The Role

Use your python knowledge to write and maintain safe, clean, and testable code.
Work with both engineers and researchers to create, train, test, and deploy algorithms from large neural nets to custom models in production products.
Shepard modeling projects through their entirety, including high-level design, prototyping, training, testing, and deploying.
Deeply study and understand both our structured and unstructured data
Work with out-of-memory video and image data as well as tabular data through custom APIs to create compound, multiple model solutions satisfying product needs.
Design installable software to clean, perform analysis, and train models.
Communicate product-level needs and guidelines to other teams resulting from modeling choices
Stay sharp by finding ways to grow your knowledge and help us to continually improve.
Find ways to apply your adaptability and flexibility. We're a small group and need all the teamwork we can get to reach our goals.
Requirements
Education and Work Experience

Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science or mathematics, or alternate degree showcasing machine learning skills
Experience collaborating on software projects using version control such as Git, GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.
Additional Requirements

Must be able to pass an FBI background check
Position requires access to Covered Defense Information for which the US Government requires US Citizenship
Senseye participates in E-Verify to confirm the eligibility of employees to work in the United States
Senseye maintains a drug free workplace and conducts pre-employment substance abuse testing. Senseye may also conduct substance abuse testing during employment, in accordance with its policies and customer requirements. Employment is subject to passing such tests.

Our General Hiring Process
Step 1: Non technical interview with our Director of People Ops
Step 2: Technical phone interview - chat with one of our Engineering team members
Step 3: Coding challenge - show us your problem solving skills
Option of take-home or on-site coding challenge based on applicant’s schedule and needs
Step 4: In person interviews with our Engineering members
Step 5: Offer
Benefits
The freedom and trust to define your role as we design, build, and ship our products
Competitive salary and stock option plan
Flexible schedules
Mothers' room
Company health care plan (covers 100 percent of employee’s)
Medical and dental insurance
Short and long term disability insurance
Life insurance policy
Option to add vision insurance at a low cost
Options to add insurance coverage for spouses, domestic partners, and children
401k
Flexible paid time off (vacation, sick leave, and public holidays)
Commuter benefits for parking, public transit, carshares, etc.
Fully stocked kitchen with snacks and drinks
Catered lunches
Opportunities for continuing education

Senseye is dedicated to building a community of employees that are diverse, passionate, and engaged. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status. When we're safe, healthy, and balanced we can accomplish phenomenal things together.

-
Did you know that women apply for open jobs only if they think they meet 100 percent of the criteria listed? Men will apply to that same posting if they feel they meet 60 percent of the requirements.
We know that not everyone comes from the same background, has had the same experiences, or education, and we wouldn’t want it any other way. Don’t worry about checking every single box, instead we want you to bring your own unique outlook to the team, whatever that might be!

Title: Machine Learning and AI Research Scientist (FY19)
FullDescriptions:
Come Join Analog Devices – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For the past 50 years, Analog Devices has been inventing innovative technologies that transform lives. Get hands-on experience working with the brightest minds to solve complex problems that matter: from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality to remote healthcare. Enjoy a culture that values aligned goals, balanced work-life priorities, continuous learning throughout your career and shared rewards. At ADI, we invest in you and succeed together because we believe that happy, healthy, intellectually-challenged people drive our growth and market leadership.
ADI at a Glance
ADI helps customers bridge the physical and digital worlds with unmatched technologies that solve real-life problems and make the world smarter, healthier, greener and safer. With over $5 billion in revenue, ADI specializes in high-performance analog, mixed-signal, power, and digital signal processing (DSP) integrated circuits that sense, measure, interpret, connect, power, secure and transform how the world experiences the world around them.
The Analog Garage Research Lab in Boston, MA researches innovative and groundbreaking technologies for Analog Devices. The Algorithmic Systems Group within the Analog Garage creates advanced algorithms in the fields of machine learning, computer vision, artificial intelligence, signal processing, communication systems, and other areas of electrical engineering and computer science. Our researchers bring these algorithms to life in practical and efficient hardware. The Algorithmic Systems Group is looking for a machine learning and AI Research Scientist to join our lab.
Machine Learning and AI Research Scientists are expected to advance the scientific and technological state of the art. They will work in a collaborative and hands-on environment to solve challenging problems that arise from ADI’s diverse portfolio of applications.
Responsibilities:
Create novel algorithms specialized for applications relevant to Analog Devices.
Work with other researchers and engineers, inside and outside the Algorithmic Systems Group, to connect our work with the goals of business units throughout Analog Devices.
Stay abreast of state-of-the-art algorithms, and generate advances beyond the state of the art
Qualifications: Assumes PhD degree or equivalent experience. Candidates should have a strong mathematical background and expertise in machine learning, optimization, deep neural networks, or computer vision. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have experience in one or more of the following areas: communications systems, algorithm development, ASIC circuit design, FPGA prototyping, or software development. This search is open to new Ph.D.’s as well as more experienced candidates. More senior candidates should have experience in organizing and leading technical projects.
For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.
Analog Devices, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability
EEO is the Law: Notice of Applicant Rights Under the Law
Education Level: Doctorate Degree
Travel Required: No

Title: Lead Decision Support Analyst
FullDescriptions:
Company :
Highmark Health
Job Description :
JOB SUMMARY
Health care requires new ideas and new thinking on a daily basis. Highmark Health launched the VITAL Innovation Program to accelerate the pace that innovative health care technologies are made available to our patients.
As a Lead Decision Support Analyst (Data Scientist) on our VITAL team, your role goes beyond preparing analytical reports – help to design and analyze data from clinical studies, and develop business insights on performance of novel clinical interventions –your contribution will help fast-track new medical technologies to patients and drive changes to medical reimbursement.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Take the lead in defining parameters for each clinical study as well as the approach (methodological and technical) to be used for analyzing the potential opportunity of each novel technology.
Take the lead in developing and executing an analytic plan to measure relevant clinical, economic, and patient experience data in each unique study.
Work with clinicians, innovation companies, and other matrixed partners to identify the business and clinical data needed to produce the most useful insights to the team ensuring that the deliverables are in the most efficient and interpretable form for business users.
Create and/or develop methods of analysis for each unique study and apply appropriate statistical testing methodologies to yield measureable results on performance of novel medical technologies.
Provide assistance and, depending on skill and experience, lead with interpretation of raw data, statistical results or otherwise compiled information, identify follow-up action items and prepare or assist in the preparation of written reports and/or oral presentation of findings to internal and external audiences, clinical staff, providers,.
Develop and maintain moderate-to extremely-complex computer programs using 4GL programming languages (such as SAS, SQL) and other database technology (DB2, Teradata, or Oracle).
Support various enterprise initiatives by working as part of matrixed teams with members having a wide variety of business expertise, skill sets, and priorities. Help to drive results from these teams through various modes of support.
Develop and foster internal relationships across the corporation. Provide analytic and consultative support to the immediate project team and relevant internal business areas and external business partners.
Mentor colleagues with less experience on both the technical and business aspects of project and consultative work.
EDUCATION
Required
Bachelor's Degree in Computer/Information Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics, Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, or related field
Preferred
Master's or doctorate Degree in Computer/Information Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics, Clinical or Biomedical Research, Industrial Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Operations Research, or related field
EXPERIENCE
Required
7 years of relevant, progressive experience in the area of specialization, including experience in leading projects of varying size and complexity. Grandfathered experience requirement effective August 2016
Preferred
Experience and demonstrated proficiency as a Decision Support Analyst or equivalent training and experience in a business or clinical environment.
Experience with study design, statistical analysis, and report writing in a clinical or biomedical research environment.
SKILLS
Strong technical skills in the mainframe, PC and Internet-based technologies to be effective and must be comfortable and proficient using large and complex databases
4GL programming languages (such as SAS, SQL) and other database technology (DB2, Teradata, and Oracle).
Strong skills using various third-party office and report generation products such as Microsoft Office, Business Objects, Cognos, and Enterprise Guide.
Strong communication and writing skills. Must be comfortable presenting findings and offering recommendations to senior management.
Understanding of claims processing and medical billing and coding is a plus
SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Does this role supervise/manage other employees?
No

WORK ENVIRONMENT
Is Travel Required?
No

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Company Description

Govini is a data analytics firm dedicated to transforming the business of national security through data science and machine learning. Through its analytical platform, Govini delivers objective, decision-grade information at scale to the U.S. national security enterprise, so that leaders can better direct investments to innovation and modernization. Govini has offices in Arlington, Virginia, San Francisco, California, and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our team to build cutting-edge machine learning technologies that will replace complex, time-consuming, manual processes with automation and intelligence that will help Govini end-users make scientific and analytical decisions.

We're looking for world-class talent to join our team where you will have the opportunity to help develop solutions from data collection to large scale data manipulation to long term data storage and low-latency retrieval, reporting and analytical systems to solve big data problems that drive business performance.

This is a team member position, working onsite in our Pittsburgh, PA office.

Scope of Responsibilities

Actively create, architect and deliver state of the art machine learning solutions designed to add intelligence to our data analysis and software-as-a-service platform

Establish meaningful criteria for evaluating algorithm performance and suitability

Develop clear software specifications for implementing trained models

Implement working, scalable, production-ready Machine Learning and AI Process Automation models and code

Optimize processes for maximum speed, performance and accuracy

Participate in the end to end software development of new feature functionality and design capabilities

Craft clean, testable and maintainable code

Keep up to date with Machine Learning best practices and evolving open source frameworks

Regularly seek out innovation and continuous improvement, finding efficiency in all assigned tasks

Work in an agile team in a scrum process, collaborating closely with fellow software engineers, data scientists, data engineers and QA engineers

Qualifications

In order to do this job well, you must be a curious and eager problem solver with a hunger for building well-designed, high quality solutions. You have a passion for great work and nothing less than your best will do. You share our intolerance of mediocrity. You’re uber-smart, challenged by figuring things out and producing simple solutions to complex problems. Knowing there are always multiple answers to a problem, you know how to engage in a constructive dialogue to find the best path forward. You’re scrappy. We like scrappy.

U.S. Citizenship is required

Required Skills

Bachelor's, Master’s or Doctorate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a related field

Minimum 5 years experience in hands-on development of machine learning models

Practical experience of building, developing and productionizing machine learning systems

Advanced software skills in Python

Experience in NLP

Experience in using machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow or Keras

Hands-on experiences with AWS and cloud infrastructure

Excellent math skills

A strong desire to learn and investigate new technologies

Expertise with building or using systems, such as Apache Beam or Spark, that does data processing

Prior hands-on experience working with data-driven analytics

Experience working in agile/scrum teams

Ability to work independently with little supervision

A burning desire to work in a challenging fast paced tech environment

Desired Skills

Track record of implementing data-driven products

Familiarity with Git source control management

Experience in or exposure to the nuances of a startup or other entrepreneurial environment

We firmly believe that past performance is the best indicator of future performance. If you believe you meet the qualifications above, and you’re prepared to perform complex, mentally rigorous work, we’re eager to hear from you.

Press

"Some of the biggest government contractors are looking to Silicon Valley for help winning new contracts. Big data analytics company Govini is promising companies better analytics geared toward identifying new opportunities to win work." - Washington Post

"Govini is all set to disrupt the market for professional services in government contracting in much the same way Google disrupted the market for advertising - by automating processes that were once handled in a one-off, non-repeatable basis." - FCW

"There are many professional services firms that just help manage processes around revenue capture. They, by hand, pull data and run metrics and shove stuff into Excel and in databases and come out with answers. In Govini, you can get the same answers in three clicks." - Federal Times

Govini is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Jr. Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Skills:
Experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, Caffe, or MXNet) and knowledge of neural network fundamentals.
Experience with GPU programming with CUDA, OpenCL and/or GPU-based software acceleration libraries.
Flexible, results-oriented problem-solver who requires minimal supervision. Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges.
Willingness to learn one or more wireless communication standards (GSM, CDMA, UMTS, LTE, iDEN, Tetra, etc.).
Ability to meaningfully communicate with members of all engineering disciplines (Hardware, RF, Software, FPGA, etc), as well as management.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent understanding of real-time embedded software design and be proficient in Linux, C, C++, Python and other software languages and operating systems.
Agile software development and/or Git/JIRA experience is a plus.
Responsibilities:
Participate in cutting edge artificial intelligence (AI) research and product development, focused on embedded, edge device wireless communication systems.
Develop solutions for real world systems, leveraging AI/ML algorithms for standalone products and to enhance existing Applied Technology offerings.
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary product development teams to identify performance improvement opportunities and integrate trained models.
Perform duties in all areas of development (i.e. requirements analysis, high and low-level design, coding, model training and evaluation, documentation, real world testing, and validation).
Hands-on interaction with product hardware for developing and debugging.
Requirement:
Bachelor's (BS) or Master's (MS) degree, preferably in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, or related technical field.
Experience programming in C, C++, Python or Java.
Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements.
FullDescriptions:
Company Overview
At Motorola Solutions, we create technologies our customers refer to as their lifeline. Our technology platforms in communications, software, video and services help our customers work safely and more efficiently. Whether it’s helping firefighters see through smoke, enabling police officers to see around street corners, or reliably keeping the lights on in homes and businesses around the world, our work supports those who put their lives on the line to keep us safe. Bring your passion, potential and talents to Motorola Solutions, and help us usher in a new era in public safety and security.

Department Overview
The Applied Technology organization puts some of Motorola Solutions' brightest minds on unique, highly challenging projects. Based on decades of experience with our customers, we apply leading-edge technologies to support security and safety throughout the world. We engineer our products from start to finish and manufacture them in-house. We're known for low volume and high capability with focused specialization in areas including software-defined radios, advanced antenna solutions, artificial intelligence and machine learning, cybersecurity, signals intelligence and more. We can't tell you much more about what we do, but we can tell you it's amazing.

Job Description
Candidates for this position are software engineers with strong programming skills who demonstrate curiosity, continuous learning, and an ability to adapt. Ideal candidates have a background in Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning along with diverse knowledge and a wide variety of interests, especially in cellular / wireless communications. Hands-on experience in embedded software development is also beneficial. Our products are developed to very high standards of quality and reliability and you will be expected to learn and conform to the department’s software process during all development activities. You will have the opportunity to create proof-of-concept and low-volume specialty communications products for government and private industry.


Responsibilities:
Participate in cutting edge artificial intelligence (AI) research and product development, focused on embedded, edge device wireless communication systems.
Develop solutions for real world systems, leveraging AI/ML algorithms for standalone products and to enhance existing Applied Technology offerings.
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary product development teams to identify performance improvement opportunities and integrate trained models.
Perform duties in all areas of development (i.e. requirements analysis, high and low-level design, coding, model training and evaluation, documentation, real world testing, and validation).
Hands-on interaction with product hardware for developing and debugging.

Specific Skills/Knowledge:
Experience with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, Caffe, or MXNet) and knowledge of neural network fundamentals.
Experience with GPU programming with CUDA, OpenCL and/or GPU-based software acceleration libraries.
Flexible, results-oriented problem-solver who requires minimal supervision. Projects can vary greatly from one to the next, so you must thrive on variety and enjoy taking on new challenges.
Willingness to learn one or more wireless communication standards (GSM, CDMA, UMTS, LTE, iDEN, Tetra, etc.).
Ability to meaningfully communicate with members of all engineering disciplines (Hardware, RF, Software, FPGA, etc), as well as management.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent understanding of real-time embedded software design and be proficient in Linux, C, C++, Python and other software languages and operating systems.
Agile software development and/or Git/JIRA experience is a plus.

Basic Requirements
Bachelor's (BS) or Master's (MS) degree, preferably in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, or related technical field.
Experience programming in C, C++, Python or Java.
Must be a U.S. citizen with ability to obtain necessary security clearance as required by government contract. Some contracts may have higher-level clearance requirements.

Travel Requirements
None

Relocation Provided
None

Position Type
New Grad

Referral Payment Plan
No

Title: Senior Marketing Manager - Growth Marketing
Qualifications:
7+ years in database driven marketing, or business/strategy consulting; CRM experience preferred
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or relevant field of study; MBA preferred
Excellent project management and communication skills
Deep knowledge of email best practices and domestic CAN-SPAM laws
Experience designing and executing A/B/n tests
Ability to work well under pressure and adapt quickly to change
Familiarity with key marketing metrics – comfortable leveraging data to drive business decisions
Collaborative and diplomatic approach to working with internal and external partners
Highly flexible, ability to handle changing directions/priorities and roles as business needs evolve
Detail oriented with the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment
Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
Team player and ability to work effectively with multiple cross-functional groups
Responsibilities:
You will drive strategy and operations in the Growth Marketing team, owning key customer growth programs
Manage and develop a small team of marketing specialists to drive customer growth
You will own an annual budget and be responsible for optimal allocation against business goals
Lead constant campaign optimization of all program components (e.g. email subject lines/templates/content, channel selection, promotional calendar, etc.)
You will test and optimize promotional structures for specific segments
You will partner with Product to develop new tool features that enhance email and app delivery and effectiveness; act as the team’s center of excellence for the campaign toolset
Develop deep understanding of drivers of campaign performance on short and long-term business metrics
Partner with central and vertical merchandising teams, supply teams, program owners, and external vendors to ensure deployment of various marketing programs
You will own reporting and forecasting for individual campaigns, overall programs and assist in tracking trends in engagement metrics and financial performance
Work closely with business analyst and data scientist teams to both further understand the full business impact of programs as well as drive continued personalization of the customer experience to improve performance
Serve as backup for marketing execution by your team
FullDescriptions:
Connecting with our customers is at the heart of everything we do.
Are you the kind of person where your creativity shines when problem solving? Or your analytic interests peak when finding new ways to engage and connect with customers across marketing channels? Does your attention to detail ensure flawless execution and a compelling customer experience?
Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building Groupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.
Our Growth Marketing Team enables every aspect of the customer experience to focus on attracting and engaging customers and maximizing lifetime value at every stage of their journey.
As Senior Marketing Manager, you will be in charge of a small team managing programs in support of the company’s customer growth targets. You will manage a budget, external vendor relationships and several key CRM programs to activate, retain, and reactivate customers through multiple marketing channels. As a successful candidate, you will be proficient in CRM and email campaign programs and management including direct experience with email execution (audience selection, deliverability, template optimization, subject line best practices, list management), email performance metrics, and project management fundamentals. You are also able to multitask and work collaboratively with marketing, merchandising, product development, and other partners. You will drive continued growth, performance, and operational excellence from our key programs and look strategically at the allocation of our budget and resources to recommend new tests, tactics, and approaches to drive step changes in sustainable customer growth.
We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We're curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?
Responsibilities:
You will drive strategy and operations in the Growth Marketing team, owning key customer growth programs
Manage and develop a small team of marketing specialists to drive customer growth
You will own an annual budget and be responsible for optimal allocation against business goals
Lead constant campaign optimization of all program components (e.g. email subject lines/templates/content, channel selection, promotional calendar, etc.)
You will test and optimize promotional structures for specific segments
You will partner with Product to develop new tool features that enhance email and app delivery and effectiveness; act as the team’s center of excellence for the campaign toolset
Develop deep understanding of drivers of campaign performance on short and long-term business metrics
Partner with central and vertical merchandising teams, supply teams, program owners, and external vendors to ensure deployment of various marketing programs
You will own reporting and forecasting for individual campaigns, overall programs and assist in tracking trends in engagement metrics and financial performance
Work closely with business analyst and data scientist teams to both further understand the full business impact of programs as well as drive continued personalization of the customer experience to improve performance
Serve as backup for marketing execution by your team
Qualifications:
7+ years in database driven marketing, or business/strategy consulting; CRM experience preferred
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or relevant field of study; MBA preferred
Excellent project management and communication skills
Deep knowledge of email best practices and domestic CAN-SPAM laws
Experience designing and executing A/B/n tests
Ability to work well under pressure and adapt quickly to change
Familiarity with key marketing metrics – comfortable leveraging data to drive business decisions
Collaborative and diplomatic approach to working with internal and external partners
Highly flexible, ability to handle changing directions/priorities and roles as business needs evolve
Detail oriented with the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment
Strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
Team player and ability to work effectively with multiple cross-functional groups
Personal Qualities:
Constantly delivers progress and will not allow the perfect to become the enemy of the good
Unquenchable curiosity and desire to learn
Deadline driven with bias towards ruthless prioritization
Bias for action, and experience making things happen in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Entrepreneurial in the truest sense: able to make things happen using resources that either don’t exist or aren’t under your direct control
Able to see the forest and the trees and not fall victim to just doing what was done before
Excellent people manager: able to develop and grow a team and help them get the most out of themselves

Title: R&D Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Corva is the emerging leader in real-time drilling data and analytics. We are looking for dynamic individuals to join our team and contribute to our daily operations and strategic direction. Our team strives to exceed our customers’ expectations with every interaction.

The Research Data Scientist is responsible for utilizing data to develop machine learning models to be used in modeling drilling, completions, and related operations. The Research Data Scientist builds analytical models and develops a corresponding simulation package to optimize operations. The data scientist works closely with software developers to build UI (User Interface) to illustrate trends and provide insight as well as analyzes various drilling data to develop recommendations to customers.

Responsibilities and Duties

Understand, review, and explore drilling and completions data features
Train and optimize machine learning models
Develop production real-time models
Collaborate with team on product development and product support
Clearly communicate with team and management
Document work as requested
Support operations with procedures, reviews, and customer interaction
Adhere to timeframes and deadlines set forth
Conduct research on targeted drilling operations and establish comprehensive analytical models
Work with software developers for an easily-readable result illustration
Provide testing and debugging prior to software release
Finish the written report in a timely manner for progress record
Think beyond simply the engineering equations, anticipate drilling problems, devise solutions and choose the best alternatives
Communicate with customers to resolve issues as needed
Review data and trends to identify value-add insight to customers
Identify and communicate opportunities to improve efficiencies in operations
Be on call for solving data issues as required
Other duties as required

Qualifications and Skills

Required:

Basic knowledge of drilling operations and downhole tools, including drill string and BHA configurations, drilling bits and casing tubular
Four-year degree in petroleum engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or civil engineering
Proficiency in machine learning technology
Working knowledge of JAVA
Proficiency in Python/Ruby/Matlab/R programming
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Leadership skills and ability to work well with teams effectively
Analytical thinking skills
Ability to identify anomalies and problem data
Ability to train others

Recommended but not required:

Master or Doctorate in petroleum engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering or civil engineering

Title: Director, Machine Learning
Qualifications:
MS or PhD. Degree in relevant discipline (Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Health Sciences)
5+ years’ experience in advanced analytics and applied machine learning solutions
5+ years’ experience in working in Big Data environments, specifically Hadoop
3+ years’ experience developing and managing data science, machine learning or advanced analytics teams
Experience developing machine learning models in an exploratory data analysis environment then working with others to develop production ready versions of the models that are deployed within operational environments
Flexibility to work with global teams as well geographically dispersed US based teams
Skills:
MS or PhD. Degree in relevant discipline (Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Health Sciences)
5+ years’ experience in advanced analytics and applied machine learning solutions
5+ years’ experience in working in Big Data environments, specifically Hadoop
3+ years’ experience developing and managing data science, machine learning or advanced analytics teams
Experience developing machine learning models in an exploratory data analysis environment then working with others to develop production ready versions of the models that are deployed within operational environments
Flexibility to work with global teams as well geographically dispersed US based teams
Responsibilities:
Work with MLSA management, operations teams, product teams and technology teams to identify potential AI/ML use cases, develop value propositions for each, identify risks associated with each and ultimately recommend use case that should move forward as projects.
Identify the number of data scientists and data science team leads required to develop the use cases identified and recruit this talent to the team.
Work with data science team leads and data scientists to monitor the progress of model development, the achievement of model value, the mitigation of model development risk, and report status to MLSA and Senior Management.
Work with the MLSA business analysts to track overall monthly value delivered by the team.
Work with MLSA management to enhance the model development life cycle processes to continuously improve and enhance the productivity of data scientists while increasing the quality of the models deployed.
Ensure all data scientists on the team adhere to model development standards and processes.
Develop career plans for the data scientists on the team based on performance reviews and feedback from data science team leads and project stakeholders.
Develop training plans for data scientists, including recommendations for conference participation.
Manage and lead knowledge sharing sessions for data scientists on the team to share latest developments in AI and machine learning as well as share how techniques are being utilized within the company
Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan.
Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned.
Requirement:
Experience in using machine learning tools to develop production strength models including, but not limited to, Python, pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, spark, scala, hive, and impala
Understand different models/model versions and able to articulate and present it to different groups
Knowledge or Experience in Machine Learning Platform based architecture and Model Life Cycle in Training and Scoring
A working knowledge of SQL, able to write SQL queries to efficiently extract data from relational databases
FullDescriptions:
Cotiviti is looking for an industry leading Director focused on Machine Learning solutions to join a revolution in Healthcare Technology and lead a team of talented data scientists in building value-oriented, production level machine learning solutions. This role should appeal to a seasoned technologist, with experience in data science and machine learning, who is seeking an opportunity to manage the application of machine learning solutions to deliver value. This person will be a key decision maker in what initiatives to pursue, a strategist in developing how Cotiviti’s machine learning platform will evolve, and the primary point of contact between the machine learning development team and the business stakeholders. While not a hands-on data science role, a strong understanding of data science and machine learning technologies and techniques will be critical to success in this role. Cotiviti’s Machine Learning and Strategic Analytics team consists of data scientists, engineers and data analysts dedicated to developing and implementing robust, scalable, value-based solutions on our proprietary machine learning platform that uses a blend of best in class vendor solutions, together with custom built capabilities where gaps in the market exist. With access to a dedicated Hadoop based multi-node cluster the team can work with a vast amount of structured and unstructured data including claims, membership, physician demographics, medical records and others to begin to solve some of the most pressing healthcare issues of our time. The Director of Machine Learning at Cotiviti will be given the opportunity to work directly with a team of operations and healthcare professionals including analysts, clinicians, coding specialists, auditors and innovators to set aggressive goals and execute on them with the team. This is for an ambitious leader who is looking to utilize their experience in machine learning to create the future of healthcare within a company that is looking to put AI at the heart of their business .
Responsibilities:
As Director, Machine Learning in the Machine Learning and Strategic Analytics (MLSA) team within Cotiviti you will be responsible for delivering solutions that help our clients identify payment integrity issues, reduce the cost of healthcare processes, or improve the quality of healthcare outcomes through the application of artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques. You will be responsible for working with MLSA management to identify, prioritize, assign and deliver value that can be derived from AI/ML initiatives. You will be expected to develop processes and practices that allow models to be incorporated into our machine learning platform for production execution and monitoring, and define the flexibility allowed in initial exploratory data analysis to effectively develop models while also making them easy to deploy and monitor in production.
Work with MLSA management, operations teams, product teams and technology teams to identify potential AI/ML use cases, develop value propositions for each, identify risks associated with each and ultimately recommend use case that should move forward as projects.
Identify the number of data scientists and data science team leads required to develop the use cases identified and recruit this talent to the team.
Work with data science team leads and data scientists to monitor the progress of model development, the achievement of model value, the mitigation of model development risk, and report status to MLSA and Senior Management.
Work with the MLSA business analysts to track overall monthly value delivered by the team.
Work with MLSA management to enhance the model development life cycle processes to continuously improve and enhance the productivity of data scientists while increasing the quality of the models deployed.
Ensure all data scientists on the team adhere to model development standards and processes.
Develop career plans for the data scientists on the team based on performance reviews and feedback from data science team leads and project stakeholders.
Develop training plans for data scientists, including recommendations for conference participation.
Manage and lead knowledge sharing sessions for data scientists on the team to share latest developments in AI and machine learning as well as share how techniques are being utilized within the company
Completes all responsibilities as outlined on annual Performance Plan.
Completes all special projects and other duties as assigned.

Required Skills
Applied Machine Learning: Experience and familiarity with implementation of machine learning solutions within a production environment. While not a hands-on role, it will be expected that candidates can converse effectively with data scientists about their projects and approaches and provide guidance on solutions.
Big Data Analysis: Familiarity with Big Data environments with the ability to interact with technology counterparts on requirements and issues related to the dedicated machine learning Hadoop cluster.
Reasoning and Problem Solving: Ability to actively and skillfully conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action
Consulting: Demonstrated ability to make and gain acceptance of data-driven recommendations made to business owners. Strong ability to appropriately summarize and effectively communicate strategies, complex concepts and techniques & varied data sets to inform stakeholders, gain approval, or prompt actions; Applies to multiple audiences ranging from the analyst to executive level; Includes oral & written communication and multimedia presentation
Business Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of health insurance, the managed care model, industry coding/policy standards, the claim adjudication process, and issues related to fraud waste and abuse; Ability to apply this knowledge to the development & evaluation of new initiatives and support leading the team strategy toward best practices.
Financial Analysis: Ability to understand, generate and evaluate healthcare utilization, unit cost and medical cost trends. This includes understanding levers that effect healthcare cost, such as contracting, networks, policies, benefit structures, and product design. Ability to draw conclusions and make recommendations based on financial data

Required Competencies
Communicates With Impact: Presents information and ideas in a thoughtful and compelling manner. Is clear and concise in verbal and written communications. Shares information freely and speaks openly and honestly. Seeks to understand the perspectives of others.
Drives and Delivers Results: Sets clear priorities, takes action, stays focused, and overcomes barriers to deliver expected results.
Applied Reasoning: Evaluates critical information needed to understand problems, determine probable causes, and develop workable solutions. Accurately assesses the costs, benefits, and risks associated with alternative courses of action and makes high quality and timely decisions.
Champion s Change: Sees emerging patterns and opportunities. Adapts quickly and easily to new information, changing conditions or unexpected events. Facilitates and communicates change across the team or organization to drive adoption.
Innovation: Seeks to find new ways to solve a problem that have not been considered before. Challenges the status quo and is able to research and demonstrate that new approaches are possible and preferable.
Lives Our Values: Behaves in a way that consistently demonstrates commitment to Cotiviti values of openness, accountability, customer-driven and collaboration.
Information Security and Compliance: Demonstrates understanding of Cotiviti policies, procedures, and external regulatory requirements, and performs duties in accordance with such regulatory requirements. Assures confidentiality and security of all data. Demonstrates the skills, knowledge, and ability to ensure that our environment is a safe one, complying with industry standards.

Basic Qualifications
MS or PhD. Degree in relevant discipline (Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Health Sciences)
5+ years’ experience in advanced analytics and applied machine learning solutions
5+ years’ experience in working in Big Data environments, specifically Hadoop
3+ years’ experience developing and managing data science, machine learning or advanced analytics teams
Experience developing machine learning models in an exploratory data analysis environment then working with others to develop production ready versions of the models that are deployed within operational environments
Flexibility to work with global teams as well geographically dispersed US based teams
Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information
Be value-driven, understand that success is based on the impact of your work rather than its complexity or the level of effort.
Ability to handle multiple tasks, prioritize and meet deadlines
Ability to manage a matrixed organization
Proficiency in all required skills and competencies above

Additional Beneficial Requirements:
Experience in using machine learning tools to develop production strength models including, but not limited to, Python, pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, spark, scala, hive, and impala
Understand different models/model versions and able to articulate and present it to different groups
Knowledge or Experience in Machine Learning Platform based architecture and Model Life Cycle in Training and Scoring
A working knowledge of SQL, able to write SQL queries to efficiently extract data from relational databases
Knowledge of machine learning tools such as DataRobot, H2O, ML Flow
Knowledge or experience of DevOps lifecycle tools like GitHub/Gitlab/BitBucket, Jenkins, Jira
Experience in natural language processing (NLP) techniques
Experience in deep learning techniques
Proficiency in applying various mathematical and statistical models to include, but not limited to: Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, Time Series, Support Vector Machines, Collaborative Filtering, and Unsupervised Clustering

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

FullDescriptions:
Udacity's mission is to democratize education. We're an online learning platform offering groundbreaking education in fields such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, robotics, virtual reality, and more. Focused on self-empowerment through learning, Udacity is making innovative technologies such as self-driving cars available to a global community of aspiring technologists, while also enabling learners at all levels to skill up with essentials like programming, web and app development. If you love a challenge, and truly want to make a difference in the world, read on!

As a Data Analyst on the Global Consumer Marketing team, you will be one of the key partners for fellow marketers and business leaders at Udacity to help inform our marketing initiatives and strategy decisions. You will provide insights about our students' behavior and business metrics, and help develop a data team strategy to ensure Udacity makes data-driven product and business decisions.

Responsibilities:
-----------------


Contribute to the strategy for data analytics, insights, and infrastructure at Udacity
Find opportunities in marketing funnel and channels to optimize conversion and make direct impact to top line revenue

Collaborate with cross-functional team members including product managers and other software engineers to deliver compelling products/services
Be a thought leader in the data and product teams around experimentation and product insights

What We Value:
--------------


Background in applied math, computer science, statistics, finance or related technical field, and 4+ years of industry experience
Extensive experience with relational databases and SQL
Prior experience with data cleaning and modeling
Prior experience with product behavior and funnel data preferred
Excellent data communication and story telling ability
Advanced SQL is preferred
Experience deriving and presenting insights from data analyses to product and/or business leaders

FullDescriptions:
Current Need
The Senior Data Analytics Specialist is a new position and, as part of the Internal Audit team, will support department efforts to extract, analyze and visualize data. Primary responsibilities include obtaining, organizing, and delivering on data requests for various Internal Audit projects and anti-fraud initiatives. The data analytics program will deepen the team’s and McKesson’s understanding of risk and dramatically increase the impact of the Internal Audit department. The Senior Data Analytics Specialist will report directly to the Data Analytics Senior Manager and will contribute to the development of the audit analytics program by creating analytic models, continuous monitoring, and dashboards. The department currently uses SQL for scripting and Tableau for Data Visualization but will expand to emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Robotics.

Interact with auditees and data experts within the business to understand process and system flows and their audit and data implications and assist in designing audit testing

Ensure proper documentation, validation of data and completion of the project

Evaluate and communicate project results to the Data Analytics Senior Manager and discuss potential best practices, continuous monitoring reports and/or COSO audit steps, where applicable, to maintain a focus on the related fraud/internal control risk going forward
Participate in brainstorming and creation of ad-hoc/continuous monitoring reporting as needed to support internal investigations, special projects and the on-going monitoring of fraud risks
Work with and support audit staff to provide the information they need for various special projects, process audits, anti-fraud initiatives or internal investigations
Evaluate continuous monitoring reports for potentially fraudulent activity and conduct follow-up
Mentor Internal Audit staff through the development and presentation of fraud/data mining related training and intranet materials
Seek to improve job performance through self-assessment, skill development, training and goal setting
Learn and research data sources within McKesson, across various business units and systems
Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

4 years of work-related experience
2 years of experience in data analysis

Strong quantitative analysis background and experience in working with large, complex data systems to aggregate, organize, and prepare data for use in business analysis
SQL writing proficiency; experience using R or Python for analytics
Modeling in Excel and/or other statistical tools
Additional Knowledge & Skills
Experience with tools such as SAP, Alteryx, Tableau or equivalents, preferred
Effective project management skills
Able to demonstrate creativity and research skills to tackle analytics or automation projects without step-by-step instructions
Ability to leverage McKesson’s internal resources or publicly available information to solve problems and build data models

Excellent organization, communication and analytical skills

Ability to work and succeed in a multi-cultural environment
Strategic, proactive, creative, innovative, and collaborative

Fast and capable learner

Enjoys process improvement projects

FullDescriptions:
Data Analyst (Pricing)


uShip has a unique opportunity to support its automobile logistics team with advanced data science and analytical techniques. The primary focus of the data scientist will be to develop reliable pricing models for transporting automobiles throughout the US and Canada. The data scientist will interface with a number of departments and the executive team while advancing our strategic initiatives in a highly competitive marketplace.


Primary Responsibilities
Work with primary stakeholders to understand project requirements
Gather data from internal and external sources
Work closely with data architecture and analyst teams
Generate reliable pricing models that may be integrated within the uShip product
Create testing pipelines that evaluate the effectiveness of the model output
Iterate on models to optimize performance
Regularly present findings to stakeholders and executive team
Work with product and development teams to integrate models
Work within the AWS ecosystem to house data, train, and deploy models
Continuously research and update skillset


Requirements
Undergraduate degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or other relevant field.
Strong SQL skills
Competency at creating reliable data pipelines
Fluent in at least one object-oriented programming language (e.g. Python, Java, Scala or R)
Solid understanding of Statistics, A/B testing, hypothesis testing
Strong understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms (Supervised/Unsupervised, classification/regression, etc.)
Advanced ability to perform exploratory data analysis, outlier detection, data cleaning, feature engineering
Ability to understand the output of complex algorithms and communicate to relevant parties
Basic understanding of APIs and how to host machine learning models
Iterate on models rapidly to optimize team performance and revenue
Work closely with operations leaders to jointly own daily, weekly, and monthly profitability reports
Willingness to proactively solve problems through non-conventional methods or approaches
Entrepreneurial spirit, eager to work closely with front line operations teams, their customers, and 3rd parties


Preferred
Experience with geographical data
Experience with Time Series analysis
Familiarity with major commerce routes or freight lanes
Economic analysis of impacts of promotional pricing

Why work at uShip?
Competitive Salary
100% Paid health and dental insurance for the employee
Stock Options
Annual uShip Free Shipping Allowance ($500)
Free lunch, snacks, and drinks
Dog friendly
Casual dress code
And so much more!


Company Overview
uShip is the world’s first and largest shipping marketplace. Consumers and businesses can compare and book bids from hundreds of thousands of customer-reviewed transportation service providers, ranging from independent owner-operators to the largest freight carriers and brokers. Customers save money and service providers use their empty cargo space – everyone wins! We’re an Internet company focused on solving a real-world problem and having loads (pun intended) of fun along the way. Our platform and service providers were even featured in A&E’s real life drama, ‘Shipping Wars.’

We welcome diversity in all its forms, and believe we’re better collaborators, strategizers, and thinkers because of it. uShip is an equal opportunity employer. We are inspired to find candidates who embody our Core Values. uShip prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, age, parental status, national origin, disability, or veteran status. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Qualifications: BS or MS in management information systems, computer science, or a related field.
Responsibilities: Support the design, build and execution of post source system extraction and data lake ingestion and business transformation, CARR creation framework and development processes in production.
FullDescriptions:
Data Engineer - (19001847)
Description

Position Summary
Our Data Engineer will be responsible for assisting with the implementation and maintenance of the enterprise wide data management solution for certified analytics and reporting rectangles (CARRs) and data assets. This includes the analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and initial maintenance of the solution and acting as interface with SME/Product owners and enterprise data analytics team, by taking a holistic approach for delivering reusable CARRs and data assets enabling data solutions.
Your Responsibilities
 Support the design, build and execution of post source system extraction and data lake ingestion and business transformation, CARR creation framework and development processes in production.
 Enhance analytic environments and platform required for structured, semi-structured and unstructured data.
 Develop data quality metrics that identify gaps and ensure compliance with enterprise wide standards.
 Provide technical support for projects and team members, along with SMEs and product owners.
 Build data pipelines to feed descriptive and predictive analytics use cases, KPI and enterprise wide reporting.
 Interface with architects, product managers/SMEs and product analysts to understand data needs and support the implementation of the business rules into transformation.
 Document the data blending process along with the specifications and workflow/data lineage.
 Maintain/add to existing data dictionaries and work with UI team for creating the profiling platform and data profiling for already created CARRs.
 Execute project-based data governance processes.
 Work with our team in India
Reporting Relationships
As our Data Engineer, you will report to our Data Scientist who reports to our Vice President, Predictive Analytics.


Qualifications

Your Qualifications
 BS or MS in management information systems, computer science, or a related field.
 4-6 years of experience in data management.
 Programming capability in Python, SQL/NoSQL and Unix/shell scripting, as well as in data engineering, databases (e.g., SQL, MongoDB), platform architecture and ETL concepts.
 Amazon Web Services experience.
 Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work across multiple groups within the organization.
 Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operation.
 Experience working with offshore colleagues
Location
 This position can be located in our newest offices in Hudson Yards in Manhattan, in our Holmdel NJ offices (the historic former Bell Labs facility) or in our Gold LEED facility in Bethlehem PA with work from home flexibility.
Travel
 Less than 10% travel between NYC, Holmdel NJ, Bethlehem PA.
Benefits
 Medical, dental, vision, and prescription plans
 Competitive compensation package
 401k with company match
 Attractive Paid Time Off (PTO)
 Life and disability insurance
 Tuition assistance program
 Wellness discounts
Philanthropic Opportunities
 Social responsibility is part of our mission. It stems from our corporate values of putting people first, doing the right thing, and holding ourselves to high standards.
 As a company and as employees, we are engaged in a variety of initiatives such as volunteering within our local communities, educational alliances with colleges, focusing on sustainability, and promoting diversity and inclusion.
Guardian has been helping people protect their futures and secure their lives for more than 150 years.
Every day, we serve approximately 27 million people through a range of insurance and financial products. We help people and their families pursue financial security and well-being in life, health, and wealth. We help companies take care of their employees. And we help people recover and thrive after unexpected loss.
From our founding in 1860, when a community of immigrants joined together to insure and protect their businesses and families, doing the right thing for our policyholders and customers has guided everything we do. Our dedication to customers has helped us remain one of the most highly rated in client satisfaction and financial strength.
And as one of the largest mutual insurance companies, we know what matters most: putting the needs of our customers first.
Because everyone deserves a Guardian.

Title: Data Engineer
FullDescriptions:
Data Engineer
It’s Time For A Change…
Your Future Evolves Here
Evolent Health has a bold mission to change the health of the nation by changing the way health care is delivered. Our pursuit of this mission is the driving force that brings us to work each day. We believe in embracing new ideas, challenging ourselves and failing forward. We respect and celebrate individual talents and team wins. We have fun while working hard and Evolenteers often make a difference in everything from scrubs to jeans.
Are we growing? Absolutely—56.7% in year-over-year revenue growth in 2016. Are we recognized? Definitely. We have been named one of “Becker’s 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare” in 2016 and 2017, and one of the “50 Great Places to Work” in 2017 by Washingtonian, and our CEO was number one on Glassdoor’s 2015 Highest-Rated CEOs for Small and Medium Companies. If you’re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don’t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it.
Who You’ll Be Working With:
You’ll join a team of data scientists, machine learning engineers, and cloud engineers working to push the boundaries of data science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) in health care. We like to experiment, iterate, and innovate with technology, from developing new algorithms specific to health care’s challenges, to bringing the latest data science, machine learning, big data and cloud best practices and applications into the health care world. We know that Data Science and Artificial Intelligence are only valuable when powered by the right data, so we focus on fully gathering the data with proper data governance to understanding the problems we need to solve, and truly understanding the data behind them before launching into solutions – ensuring that the solutions we do land on are impactful and powerful.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Be the go-to person for Data ingest and storage across Cloud, Hadoop and Network storage devices
Support Data Scientists with ETL, Data Exploration, Feature Engineering, Model development and Model Deployment when required
Collaborate with stakeholders from clinical, administrative, operations, and actuarial teams to identify Data Sources, Data feeds and external third-party data for advanced analytics opportunities to add value to Evolent’s business.
Build scalable data platforms across clouds and/or on premise as an alternate source of truth (ASOT) mirroring single source of truth (SSOT) data sources like RDBMS, Data Warehouse, SAS GRID, NoSQL and other external data to support Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers.
Make Data available for Data Exploration, Data Science and Machine Learning purpose
Solution right storage platforms from object storage on AWS/AZURE/GCP, Hadoop Data lakes to on premise network drives with proper file formats, compression, partitions, backup and archive solutions
Create data catalog for data discovery and create reports for Data governance and ETL jobs
Ingest data batch and real time from Data warehouse, Data base, SAS data grid, MongoDB, NoSQL systems, SFTP and real time services on to Data Lake, S3 objects etc.
Schedule jobs to ensure 24/7 availability, failover and graceful recovery for Data and ETL jobs
The Experience You’ll Need (Required):
Bachelor’s degree from STEM field.
1-3 years of professional experience as a Data Engineer on any Cloud and/or on-premise Hadoop systems building Data lakes
Strong technical abilities with python as a programming/scripting language, SQL for querying database/NoSQL, shell scripting on unix/linux environment
Basic understanding of security including Kerberos, public/private key, encryption/decryption, MFA
Foundational understanding of cloud and distributed platforms
Python ETL frameworks\Pyspark (we also welcome java\scala)
Data as a service(Daas) REST API/JSON/XML
Knowledge\Proficiency with Dockers
Experience working with various file formats and compression techniques like json, xml, parquet, pickle, gz, snappy etc. for efficient storage and compute
The ability to work with unstructured data
Strong communication skills, including communicating with remote team members, communicating with stakeholders from other Evolent departments to fully evaluate project requirements and context, and communicating project results, findings, and applicability.
Ability to work independently with little technical guidance day-to-day, in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency with version control systems like git
Finishing Touches (Preferred):
Master’s degree from STEM Field
Additional object & functional oriented programming languages like C++/Java/Scala
Mathematical programming languages like SAS, SPSS, R, Julia, Matlab
Proficiency/coursework in most mathematical analysis methods, statistical analyses, and/or machine learning (such as neural networks, random forests, gradient boosting, etc),
Experience in visualization tools such as Python’s bokeh, matplotlib, RShiny,, nodejs , D3
Experience with BI tools like Tableau, micro strategy, Qlikview
Knowledge/experience with Kubernetes and containers
Job Scheduling and ETL frameworks like airflow, Luigi etc.
AWS/AZURE/GCP/Hadoop certifications
Contributions to opensource
Working with image data will be a plus
Experience in healthcare industry.
Evolent Health is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

Provides actionable recommendations on how to optimize the user experience, by considering speed, stability, and key user features

Data Intelligence Engineer
Round Rock,TX
Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Data Intelligence Engineer in our Dell Digital IT Analytics and Data Science organization team in Round Rock, TX.
The Dell Digital IT Analytics and Data Science organization is responsible for insights and recommendations to optimize the user experiences. This includes analysis focused on application speed, stability, and user experience. Such work includes data ingestion, data munging, and statistical analysis. Effective outputs require simple user-friendly synthesis of information, including well-articulated insights.
The team needs individuals with strong business and analytic knowledge to deliver high value insight and recommendations. We are looking for a candidate who has a strong background in analytics, with proven abilities to be innovative and creative, as well as strong collaborator and communicator enabling influence.

Provides actionable recommendations on how to optimize the user experience, by considering speed, stability, and key user features

Build AL/ML prototypes
Leverage analytical insights to drive support product development, operational optimization to improve key business/IT metrics.
Lead cross-functional engagements to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models and make recommendations.

5+ years of related experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 3+ years with a master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Business Degree; or equivalent experience
Experience in any data mining, business analytics, data science or data scientist role
Expertise in machine learning algorithms/concepts and applying to solve business problem
Experience in most big data and statistical analytic tools: Python, Hadoop (Hive), SQL, Splunk
Hands-on analytics capabilities, expertise in analytical problem-solving techniques and frameworks and the ability to deal with large volumes of data
Strong teamwork, project management skills, business acumen skills
Strong communication skills, including the ability to convey analytic insights effectively to both IT and business audiences

Management Consulting background
Technical background in software engineering with understanding of software stack
